solution_line_template: Since Drew got {drew_correct_questions} questions right and {drew_wrong_questions} wrong, she was asked {drew_correct_questions}+{drew_wrong_questions} = <<{drew_correct_questions}+{drew_wrong_questions}={drew_total_questions}>>{drew_total_questions} questions.

Carla got twice as many questions wrong as Drew got, a total of {multiplier_twice}*{drew_wrong_questions} = <<{multiplier_twice}*{drew_wrong_questions}={carla_wrong_questions}>>{carla_wrong_questions} questions wrong.

The total number of questions that Carla was asked is {carla_wrong_questions}+{carla_correct_questions} = <<{carla_wrong_questions}+{carla_correct_questions}={carla_total_questions}>>{carla_total_questions}.

Altogether, there were {drew_total_questions}+{carla_total_questions} = <<{drew_total_questions}+{carla_total_questions}={total_questions_asked}>>{total_questions_asked} questions that were asked in the contest.
